respStmt.name: Craig A. Berry, Martin Mueller, and Clifford Wulfman
Lawrence Berland, Hilary Bina, Katherine Gould, Kreg Segal, Nicholas Terrell

publicationStmt.p: The WordHoard Shakespeare is a joint project of the Perseus Project at Tufts University, The Northwestern University Library, and Northwestern University Academic Technologies. It is derived from The Globe Shakespeare , the one-volume version of the Cambridge Shakespeare , edited by W. G. Clark, J. Glover, and W. A. Wright (1891-3). The Internet Shakespeare editions of the quartos and folios have been consulted to create a modern text that observes as closely as possible the morphological and prosodic practices of the earliest editions. Spellings, especially of contracted and hyphenated forms, have been standardized across the corpus. The text has been fully lemmatized and morphosyntactically tagged.

Â© 2003. The copyright to The WordHoard Shakespeare is owned jointly by Northwestern University and Tufts University. The WordHoard Shakespeare is provided for free solely for non-commercial use by students, scholars, and the public. Any commercial use or publication of it, in whole or in part, without prior written authorization of the copyright holders is strictly prohibited.

sourceDesc.p: The Wordhoard Shakespeare is derived from, but not identical with, The Globe Shakespeare , the one-volume version of the Cambridge Shakespeare (1891-3) edited by W. G. Clark, J. Glover, and W. A. Wright.

castGroup.head: Triumvirs after death of Julius Caesar

div.head: Act 1, Scene 1
div.stage: Enter FLAVIUS, MARULLUS, and certain Commoners.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 2
div.stage: Flourish. Enter CAESAR; ANTONY, for the course; CALPURNIA, PORTIA, DECIUS, CICERO, BRUTUS, CASSIUS, and CASCA; a great crowd following, among them a Soothsayer.

l.stage: Sennet. Exeunt all except Brutus and Cassius.
Sennet. Exeunt Caesar and all his Train, but Casca.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 3
div.stage: Thunder and lightning. Enter from opposite sides, CASCA, with his sword drawn, and CICERO.

l.stage: Enter the conspirators, CASSIUS, CASCA, DECIUS, CINNA, METELLUS CIMBER, and TREBONIUS.
Enter PUBLIUS, BRUTUS, LIGARIUS, METELLUS, CASCA, TREBONIUS, and CINNA.

div.head: Act 2, Scene 4
div.stage: Another part of the same street, before the house of Brutus.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 1
div.stage: Rome. Before the Capitol; the Senate sitting above.
A crowd of people; among them ARTEMIDORUS and the Soothsayer.
Flourish. Enter CAESAR, BRUTUS, CASSIUS, CASCA, DECIUS, METULLUS, TREBONIUS, CINNA, ANTONY, LEPIDUS, POPLIUS, PUBLIUS, and others.

l.stage: CAESAR goes up to the Senate-House, the rest following.
Casca first, then the other Conspirators and Marcus Brutus stab Caesar.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 2
div.stage: Enter BRUTUS and CASSIUS, and a throng of Citizens.

sp.speaker: Brutus
sp.stage: Enter ANTONY and others, with CAESAR's body.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 1
div.stage: ANTONY, OCTAVIUS, and LEPIDUS, seated at a table.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 2
div.stage: Camp near Sardis. Before Brutus's tent.
Drum. Enter BRUTUS, LUCILIUS, LUCIUS, and Soldiers; TITINIUS and PINDARUS meeting them.

l.stage: Enter Poet, followed by LUCILIUS, TITINIUS, and LUCIUS.
Re-enter Lucius, with wine and taper.
Exeunt all but Brutus. Re-enter Lucius, with the gown.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 1
div.stage: Enter OCTAVIUS, ANTONY, and their army.

l.stage: Drum. Enter BRUTUS, CASSIUS, and their Army; LUCILIUS, TITINIUS, MESSALA, and others.
Exeunt Octavius, Antony, and their army.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 2
div.stage: The same. The field of battle.

l.stage: Alarum. Re-enter MESSALA, with BRUTUS, young CATO, STRATO, VOLUMNIUS, and LUCILIUS.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 4
div.stage: Alarum. Enter fighting, soldiers of both armies; then BRUTUS, young CATO, LUCILIUS, and others.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 5
div.stage: Enter BRUTUS, DARDANIUS, CLITUS, STRATO, and VOLUMNIUS.

l.stage: Alarum. Cry within, âFly, fly, fly!â

div.stage: Alarum. Retreat. Enter OCTAVIUS, ANTONY, MESSALA, LUCILIUS, and the army.
